content: @BatmanAoD (Kyle Strand) @XAMPPRocky @Nell Shamrell-Harrington here is a place to continue the conversation about integration of cross domain work in languages other than Rust.

I'm surprised you mentioned C, because I think of C as not really having a "core project" outside of the ISO committee, for which my perception is that there are a couple layers of indirection between their work and that of external groups. Same for C++.

But I guess you could look at it the other way: C/C++ ISO committees are entirely comprised of "external groups" (such as corporations that send committee members).
I wonder how things like NumPy and SciPy relate to the Python project.
Those seem like very clear analogues to "domain work"
